DOC.brief_title: Low-level Light Therapy Overactive Bladder Urinary Incontinence
DOC.detailed_description: Study design : This prospective , randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled , multi-centered trial carry two university hospital . This clinical trial approve Korea Food Drug Administration Institutional Review Boards two hospital . Study process : All patient give inform write consent inform detail study . Participants randomize either LLLT placebo control group third visit . All participant underwent demographic history taking , physical examination , bladder examination laboratory test . All participant educate use device demonstration picture-guided user manual . During second visit , participant conduct self-evaluation frequency urgency urinary incontinence episode use OABSS scale underwent urine examination ( pre-treatment measurement ) . The third visit occur 7 day date second visit , clinical primary nurse describe use medical equipment device home . All subject fill self-reported diary fill UDI-6 IIQ-7 questionnaire visit . Subjects carry self-treatment way home 3 time day 12 week visit hospital week 4 12 undergo examination fill OABSS , UDI-6 IIQ-7 questionnaire ( post-treatment measurement ) . Statistical analysis : All data summarize mean Â± standard deviation number proportion . A p < 0.05 consider indicate significance . The investigator decide therapeutic effect would > 20 % reduction frequency urgency urinary incontinence episode treatment . The statistical analysis conduct use self-reported micturition diary 12 week visit primary endpoint . The investigator use independent t-test Wilcoxon rank sum test depend normality data evaluate difference group frequency urgency urinary incontinence episode measure 12 week visit baseline value . To test normality , investigator perform Shapiro-Wilk 's test . The examination ratio difference nominal variable carry use chi-square test Fisher 's exact test . A per-protocol ( PP ) intent treat ( ITT ) analyse used clinical trial ass efficacy safety . A Last observation carry forward ( LOCF ) method use ITT analysis miss data .
